com.sri.ai.grinder.polynomial.core

Class DefaultPolynomial

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sri.ai.grinder.core.AbstractExpression
      • com.sri.ai.expresso.helper.AbstractExpressionWrapper
        • com.sri.ai.grinder.polynomial.core.DefaultPolynomial
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Expression, Polynomial, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<java.lang.Object>

    @Beta
public class DefaultPolynomial
extends AbstractExpressionWrapper
implements Polynomial
    Default implementation of the Polynomial interface.
    Author:
    oreilly
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      java.lang.String toString()
      Overridden in order to avoid using Expression's implementation, which would use the cached inner expression and not produce an update String if the instance changed (remember that instances to this class are allowed to change before being used as an expression for the first time).

      • getMapFromSignatureToMonomial

        public java.util.Map<java.util.List<com.sri.ai.util.math.Rational>,Monomial> getMapFromSignatureToMonomial()
        Description copied from interface: Polynomial
        Returns the signature term map for this polynomial. The signature term map is a map from signatures (lists of Rationals) to the (unique) monomial in the polynomial with that signature.
        Specified by:
        getMapFromSignatureToMonomial in interface Polynomial
        Returns:
        the signature term map for this polynomial.

        Returns:

      • add

        public Polynomial add(Polynomial summand)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: Polynomial
        Add this polynomial to another polynomial and return a new Polynomial representing the sum. 
         
 summand(this) + summand = sum.
        Specified by:
        add in interface Polynomial
        Parameters:
        summand - the summand to be added to this polynomial.
        Returns:
        the sum of this and the summand.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the summand does not share the same signature factors as this polynomial.

      • minus

        public Polynomial minus(Polynomial subtrahend)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: Polynomial
        Subtract a given polynomial from this polynomial and return a new polynomial representing the difference of the two. 
         
 minuend(this) - subtrahend = difference.
        Specified by:
        minus in interface Polynomial
        Parameters:
        subtrahend - the subtrahend.
        Returns:
        the difference of this polynomial minus the subtrahend.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the subtrahend does not share the same signature factors as this polynomial.

      • times

        public Polynomial times(Polynomial multiplier)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: Polynomial
        Mulitply this polynomial by another. 
         
 multiplicand(this) * multiplier = product.
        Specified by:
        times in interface Polynomial
        Parameters:
        multiplier - the multiplier.
        Returns:
        the project of this polynomial and the given multiplier.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the multiplier does not share the same signature factors as this polynomial.

      • divide

        public com.sri.ai.util.base.Pair<Polynomial,Polynomial> divide(Polynomial divisor)
                                                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: Polynomial
        Divide this polynomial by another. 
         
 dividend(this) / divisor = (quotient, remainder).
        Specified by:
        divide in interface Polynomial
        Returns:
        a pair consisting of the quotient and remainder of this/divisor.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the divisor does not share the same signature factors as this polynomial.

      • set

        public Expression set(int i,
                      Expression newIthArgument)
        Description copied from interface: Expression
        If this is a function application, returns an expression equal to this one, but for replacing the i-th argument by the given one. Generates an error otherwise.
        Specified by:
        set in interface Expression
        Overrides:
        set in class AbstractExpressionWrapper

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Description copied from class: AbstractExpressionWrapper
        Overridden in order to avoid using Expression's implementation, which would use the cached inner expression and not produce an update String if the instance changed (remember that instances to this class are allowed to change before being used as an expression for the first time). This implementation re-computes an Expression every time it is invoked.
        Overrides:
        toString in class AbstractExpressionWrapper
